text: - Hi, I'm Mandy,
a software engineer here in the office
of Cupertino, California.

Today, I'm going to show you
how to monitor DLM policies.
If you haven't heard of DLM,
or Data Lifecycle Manager, before,
it's a service to help you
automate snapshot and AMI management.

Let's look at how to monitor
DLM policy state changes.
Now navigate to the Amazon EC2 Console.

Under Elastic Block Store,
select Lifecycle Manager.

This video is assuming that
you have already created
your lifecycle policies.
If not, you can refer to other DLM videos
on how to create policies.

As you can see, this policy
is in the error state.
The error message field
tells you that the policy went into error

because DLM is not
authorized to assume role.

If your lifecycle policy
is in the error state,

there might be an issue
with your resource tags,
DLM permissions or IAM permissions.

In addition, if you are
using a custom IAM role,

a trust relationship might
not be attached to the role.
Now let's fix the issue.
And just re-enable the policy.
The policy will run again.
I hope you enjoyed the video.

Check out the links
below for more resources.
Thanks for joining us!
